member.name: T:MinimalJson.JsonArray
T:MinimalJson.JsonValue
member.summary: Represents a JSON value. According to RFC 4627, a JSON value must be an object, an array, a number, a string, or one of the literal names true, false, and null. The literal names true, false, and null are represented by the constants , , and . JSON objects and arrays are represented by the subtypes and . Instances of these types can be created using the public constructors. Instances for JSON numbers and strings can be created using the static factory methods , , , etc. In order to find out whether an instance of this class is of a certain type, the methods , , , etc. can be used. If there is no doubt about the type of a JSON value, one of the methods , , , , etc. can be used to get this value directly in the appropriate target type. This class is not supposed to be extended by clients.

member.name: F:MinimalJson.JsonValue.TRUE
member.summary: Represents the JSON literal true.

member.name: F:MinimalJson.JsonValue.FALSE
member.summary: Represents the JSON literal false.

member.name: F:MinimalJson.JsonValue.NULL
member.summary: The JSON literal null.

member.name: M:MinimalJson.JsonValue.readFrom(System.IO.TextReader)
member.summary: Reads a JSON value from the given reader. Characters are read in chunks and buffered internally, therefore wrapping an existing reader in an additional BufferedReader does not improve reading performance.
member.param: the reader to read the JSON value from
member.returns: the JSON value that has been read
member.exception: if the input is not valid JSON

member.name: M:MinimalJson.JsonValue.readFrom(System.String)
member.summary: Reads a JSON value from the given string.
member.param: the string that contains the JSON value
member.returns: the JSON value that has been read
member.exception: if the input is not valid JSON

member.name: M:MinimalJson.JsonValue.valueOf(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a JsonValue instance that represents the given int value.
member.param: the value to get a JSON representation for
member.returns: a JSON value that represents the given value

member.name: M:MinimalJson.JsonValue.valueOf(System.Int64)
member.summary: Returns a JsonValue instance that represents the given long value.
member.param: the value to get a JSON representation for
member.returns: a JSON value that represents the given value

member.name: M:MinimalJson.JsonValue.valueOf(System.Single)
member.summary: Returns a JsonValue instance that represents the given float value.
member.param: the value to get a JSON representation for
member.returns: a JSON value that represents the given value

member.name: M:MinimalJson.JsonValue.valueOf(System.Double)
member.summary: Returns a JsonValue instance that represents the given double value.
member.param: the value to get a JSON representation for
member.returns: a JSON value that represents the given value

member.name: M:MinimalJson.JsonValue.valueOf(System.String)
member.summary: Returns a JsonValue instance that represents the given string.
member.param: the string to get a JSON representation for
member.returns: a JSON value that represents the given string

member.name: M:MinimalJson.JsonValue.valueOf(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns a JsonValue instance that represents the given bool value.
member.param: the value to get a JSON representation for
member.returns: a JSON value that represents the given value

member.name: M:MinimalJson.JsonValue.isObject
member.summary: Detects whether this value represents a JSON object. If this is the case, this value is an instance of .
member.returns: true if this value is an instance of JsonObject

member.name: M:MinimalJson.JsonValue.isArray
member.summary: Detects whether this value represents a JSON array. If this is the case, this value is an instance of .
member.returns: true if this value is an instance of JsonArray

member.name: M:MinimalJson.JsonValue.isNumber
member.summary: Detects whether this value represents a JSON number.
member.returns: true if this value represents a JSON number

member.name: M:MinimalJson.JsonValue.isString
member.summary: Detects whether this value represents a JSON string.
member.returns: true if this value represents a JSON string

member.name: M:MinimalJson.JsonValue.isBool
member.summary: Detects whether this value represents a bool value.
member.returns: true if this value represents either the JSON literal true or false

member.name: M:MinimalJson.JsonValue.isTrue
member.summary: Detects whether this value represents the JSON literal true.
member.returns: true if this value represents the JSON literal true

member.name: M:MinimalJson.JsonValue.isFalse
member.summary: Detects whether this value represents the JSON literal false.
member.returns: true if this value represents the JSON literal false

member.name: M:MinimalJson.JsonValue.isNull
member.summary: Detects whether this value represents the JSON literal null.
member.returns: true if this value represents the JSON literal null

member.name: M:MinimalJson.JsonValue.asObject
member.summary: Returns this JSON value as , assuming that this value represents a JSON object. If this is not the case, an exception is thrown.
member.returns: a JSONObject for this value
member.exception: if this value is not a JSON object

member.name: M:MinimalJson.JsonValue.asArray
member.summary: Returns this JSON value as , assuming that this value represents a JSON array. If this is not the case, an exception is thrown.
member.returns: a JSONArray for this value
member.exception: if this value is not a JSON array

member.name: M:MinimalJson.JsonValue.asInt
member.summary: Returns this JSON value as an int value, assuming that this value represents a JSON number that can be interpreted as Java int. If this is not the case, an exception is thrown. To be interpreted as C# int, the JSON number must neither contain an exponent nor a fraction part. Moreover, the number must be in the Integer range.
member.returns: this value as int
member.exception: if this value is not a JSON number
if this JSON number can not be interpreted as int value

member.name: M:MinimalJson.JsonValue.asLong
member.summary: Returns this JSON value as a long value, assuming that this value represents a JSON number that can be interpreted as Java long. If this is not the case, an exception is thrown. To be interpreted as C# long, the JSON number must neither contain an exponent nor a fraction part. Moreover, the number must be in the Long range.
member.returns: this value as long
member.exception: if this value is not a JSON number
if this JSON number can not be interpreted as long value

member.name: M:MinimalJson.JsonValue.asFloat
member.summary: Returns this JSON value as a float value, assuming that this value represents a JSON number. If this is not the case, an exception is thrown. If the JSON number is out of the Float range, POSITIVE_INFINITY or NEGATIVE_INFINITY is returned.
member.returns: this value as float
member.exception: if this value is not a JSON number

member.name: M:MinimalJson.JsonValue.asDouble
member.summary: Returns this JSON value as a double value, assuming that this value represents a JSON number. If this is not the case, an exception is thrown. If the JSON number is out of the Double range, POSITIVE_INFINITY or NEGATIVE_INFINITY is returned.
member.returns: this value as double
member.exception: if this value is not a JSON number

member.name: M:MinimalJson.JsonValue.asString
member.summary: Returns this JSON value as string, assuming that this value represents a JSON string. If this is not the case, an exception is thrown.
member.returns: the string represented by this value
member.exception: if this value is not a JSON string

member.name: M:MinimalJson.JsonValue.asBool
member.summary: Returns this JSON value as a bool value, assuming that this value is either true or false. If this is not the case, an exception is thrown.
member.returns: this value as bool
member.exception: if this value is neither true or false

member.name: M:MinimalJson.JsonValue.writeTo(System.IO.TextWriter)
member.summary: Writes the JSON representation for this object to the given writer.
member.param: the writer to write this value to

member.name: M:MinimalJson.JsonValue.ToString
member.summary: Returns the JSON string for this value in its minimal form, without any additional whitespace. The result is guaranteed to be a valid input for the method and to create a value that is equal to this object.
member.returns: a JSON string that represents this value

member.name: M:MinimalJson.JsonValue.GetHashCode
member.summary: Serves as a hash function for a particular type.
member.returns: A hash code for the current object.

member.name: M:MinimalJson.JsonValue.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Indicates whether some other object is "equal to" this one. Two JsonValues are considered equal if and only if they represent the same JSON text. As a consequence, two given JsonObjects may be different even though they contain the same set of names with the same values, but in a different order.
member.param: the reference object with which to compare
member.returns: true if this object is the same as the object argument; false otherwise

member.name: P:MinimalJson.JsonValue.Item(System.String)
member.summary: Gets or sets the named json value.
member.param: Name of the json value
member.returns: Value object.

member.name: P:MinimalJson.JsonValue.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets or sets the json value by index.
member.param: Index of the json value
member.returns: Value object.

member.name: M:MinimalJson.JsonArray.unmodifiableArray(MinimalJson.JsonArray)
member.summary: Returns an unmodifiable wrapper for the specified JsonArray. This method allows to provide read-only access to a JsonArray. The returned JsonArray is backed by the given array and reflects subsequent changes.
member.param: the JsonArray for which an unmodifiable JsonArray is to be returned
member.returns: an unmodifiable view of the specified JsonArray

member.summary: Represents a member of a JSON object, i.e. a pair of name and value.

member.summary: The name of this member

member.name: P:MinimalJson.JsonObject.Member.value

member.name: T:MinimalJson.ParseException
member.summary: An unchecked exception to indicate that an input does not qualify as valid JSON.

member.name: P:MinimalJson.ParseException.offset
member.summary: The absolute index of the character at which the error occurred. The index of the first character of a document is 0.

member.name: P:MinimalJson.ParseException.line
member.summary: The number of the line in which the error occurred. The first line counts as 1.

member.name: P:MinimalJson.ParseException.column
member.summary: The index of the character at which the error occurred, relative to the line. The index of the first character of a line is 0.

member.name: T:ReadOnlyDictionary`2
member.summary: A dictionary which cannot be modified.

member.name: M:ReadOnlyDictionary`2.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new instance of .

member.name: M:ReadOnlyDictionary`2.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{`0,`1})
member.summary: Creates a new instance of by copying the content of .
member.param: Source dictionary.
member.exception: is null.

member.name: M:ReadOnlyDictionary`2.System#Collections#Generic#IDictionary{TKey@TValue}#Add(`0,`1)
member.summary: Adds an element with the provided key and value to the dictionary.
member.param: The object to use as the key of the element to add.
The object to use as the value of the element to add.
member.exception: Dictionary is read only.

member.name: M:ReadOnlyDictionary`2.ContainsKey(`0)
member.summary: Determines whether the dictionary contains an element with the specified key.
member.param: The key to locate.
member.returns: true if the dictionary containsan element with the key; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:ReadOnlyDictionary`2.System#Collections#Generic#IDictionary{TKey@TValue}#Remove(`0)
member.summary: Removes the element with the specified key from the dictionary.
member.param: The key of the element to remove.
member.returns: true if the element is successfully removed; otherwise, false.
member.exception: Dictionary is read only.

member.name: M:ReadOnlyDictionary`2.TryGetValue(`0,`1@)
member.summary: Gets the value associated with the specified key.
member.param: The key whose value to get.
When this method returns, the value associated with the specified key, if the key is found; otherwise, the default value for the type of the value parameter. This parameter is passed uninitialized.
member.returns: true if the dictionary contains an element with the specified key; otherwise, false.
